messages.subject: Re:clonlara?
messages.msgSnippet: Sarah Hi there Are you in a state/place that requires lots of paperwork and reporting and all? If so, then maybe something like Clonlara would be helpful to
messages.messageBody:
Sarah

Hi there

Are you in a state/place that requires lots of paperwork and reporting
and all? If so, then maybe something like Clonlara would be helpful to
get started. I know a couple of unschoolers in fairly aggressively
hostile type places (places with few homeschoolers at all and fairly
restrictive laws) that use it and haven't had any problems. They seem
fairly laid back and willing to work *with* the direction you're taking
rather than forcing you into a set mold. But, if you have a fairly laid
back legal environment, WHY spend the money on it when you can use that
money to have FUN with the family?

Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] clonlara?
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: sarah anne cox  I am thinking of using Clonlara school.  Does anyone have experience with this school.  I would love to hear
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: sarah anne cox <sacoxf@...>

I am thinking of using Clonlara school. Does anyone have experience
with this
school. I would love to hear first hand accounts. You can back
channel me.


-=-=-=-

Sarah,

Which state are you in?

Clonlara has been given really good reviews by people I know who have
used them, but it's really not necessary.

Why do you feel you need them? Why do you feel you cannot meet your
state's requirements on your own?

There are unschoolers in every state following the law. We can probably
point you to someone in your state who can help.



~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

________________________________________________________________________
Stand above the crowd! Get a free email address that expresses who you
are at http://domains.aol.com

messages.subject: clonlara?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi just new to unschooling/homeschooling. I am thinking of using Clonlara school.  Does anyone have experience with this school.  I would love to hear first
messages.messageBody:
Hi just new to unschooling/homeschooling.

I am thinking of using Clonlara school. Does anyone have experience with this school. I
would love to hear first hand accounts. You can back channel me.

My kids are 5 and 10.

Thanks!

Sarah
